author: Special Correspondent
text:
Stretches of roads damaged in the rains have started turning dusty in various parts of Chennai Metropolitan Area and the extended areas.

Motorists have started reporting problems related to dust-filled roads in many areas.

In a city that has 471 bus-route roads managed by the Chennai Corporation and hundreds of roads managed by other local bodies and the highways, cleaning of roads continues to be neglected.

Motorists find the dust from rain-damaged roads unbearable. The Kelambakkam-Kovalam road was washed away during the flood and now restoration works are on, but the dist kicked off poses irritation to motorists’ eyes and reduces visibility. Residents have said they suffer from breathing problems driving on such stretches. The residents fault the civic authorities for not bringing in a system to keep roads dust free. Bikers are also reportedly reaching their workplace covered in dust.
title: Post-flood roads kick up a dust
